item.title: Checks | Nick Lei calls for postponement of changes for one year
item.description:
The deputy linked to the community of Fujian finds it unfair that the imposition of staying 183 days in Macao to receive the pecuniary check was implemented in relation to 2024, giving no opportunity to residents who live out to fulfill the obligation. Nick Lei argues that it is possible to verify the days of stay in the territory in the single account
Deputy Nick Lei thinks that the changes to the requirements of assignment of the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development, known as a pecuniary check, were hasty, harming the beneficiaries. "The measures were implemented too hurriedly and the imperfect application brought many inconveniences and obstacles to the residents," said the legislator in a written interpretation, adding that when the news was released "triggered discussions and social controversy." The number two on the list of the Fujian parliamentary bench in the next September 14 legislatures suggested to the government that it “fully consider the impact and inconvenience” of measures or policy adjustments, “taking into account the real needs of residents”. The deputy cites complaints of residents who criticized the hasty form as the changes were applied, which will take into account of the days past in Macau last year, "which makes many residents of Macao who live abroad to choose to be in Macau according to their personal will." Therefore, Nick Lei asks the Executive to Sam Hou Fai to consider postponing one year the implementation of the new measures to assign the cash check. Lifelong The deputy also suggests to the government to add functionality to the mobile application single account, allowing residents to verify the number of days of stay in Macau. Nick Law stresses currently, this registration can only be "processed at care posts or self-service kiosks." The introduction of functionality in mobile application not only promotes administrative efficiency, but reduces treatment costs and inconvenience for residents, the deputy says. The need to apply personally, through a third party or post documents to prove that if you are in an exception situation for those who have not spent 183 days in Macao also motivated complaints of Nick Law, who would like to see the whole process to be treated in the single account. Despite the suggestions, the deputy points out that "it is necessary to optimize and improve the policy based on the maintenance of the original intention, so that public funds can be used accurately."

item.title: Islands Hospital | Urgencies start in the fourth quarter
item.description:
The Islands Hospital may have the emergency service operating in full in the last quarter of this year, with 24 -hour consultations for non -severe clinical situations and ambulance entry into limited cases. For this month, the hospital is expected to begin to provide artificial insemination services
The opening of services at the Peking Union Medical Hospital, also known as Hospital das Ilhas, happens progressively. The hospital's subdirector, Law Wai Seng, revealed yesterday that the emergency service is expected to start operating in the last quarter of this year. At the end of 2023, the Emergency Post of the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center (CHCSJ), installed at the Macao University Hospital of Science and Technology, was transferred to the Islands Hospital and, at the time, it was reported that the emergency service would make available for 24 hours. About a year and a half later, the subdirector of Hospital das Ilhas confirms that this service will start in the last quarter of this year. Speaking on the Macao Macao Forum Morning Program of Radio Macau, Law Wai Seng pointed out that emergency services would not receive ambulances with urgent patients, taking in some exceptions. "Emergency services and first aid services are different levels. Emergency services mean that we provide 24 -hour consultations for residents who are not in a serious clinical situation. As for the cases of embarrassment by ambulance, with demanding clinical condition, our facilities are not yet prepared to provide this service," explained the official. However, the official admitted exceptions in which the islands hospital can receive ambulances with urgent patients. "When it is bad weather and traffic between the peninsula and the islands is interrupted, our experts will coordinate with the medical team that CHCSJ will send, to provide limited first aid," he added. The Miracle of Life In addition, Law Wai Seng revealed that it was agreed with health services that if the health centers users in the islands need specialized care, they can be referred with priority to the islands Hospital. Another featured subject at the Macao Forum yesterday, was the activity of the assisted procreation center of the new hospital center. The center team's head of the center, Ku Sio Kuan, pointed out by the end of this month the deadline for artificial insemination services to be available to the public. Since February, when the center began to operate, so far, 230 couples have been consulted, whose clinical condition has been evaluated and diagnosed. Ku Sio Kuan pointed out that the average age of these couples is around 37 and 30 percent are over 40 years old. The clinic also indicated that the most frequent cause of infertility is endometriosis, a disease that affects the ovaries and fallopian tubes.

item.title: Climate change and contradictions of Lula da Silva
item.description: The fact that Brazil is the fifth largest country of the globe and the seventh in terms of the number of inhabitants justifies that its president, Lula da Silva, is a politician who arouses curiosity globally. It was partly thanks to its governments that Brazil's Human Development Index (HHP3) has significantly progressed, having reached a list of 193 countries, 89th in 2024, according to the Human Development Report 2023/2024, prepared by the United Nations Development Program (UNDP). Elected three times, Lula da Silva held the presidency from 2003 to 2011 and 2023 until today. From its policy stand out the programs “Bolsa Familia” and “Hunger Zero”, recognized by the United Nations as having contributed to considerably alleviating hunger in Brazil. In addition to the fight against hunger, they are also areas where there was greater development, health and longevity, due to investment in the Unified Health System and increased vaccination programs. In the field of education there were significant progress thanks to incentives for more children and adolescents to attend primary and high school. Initiatives such as the “University for All Program” (ProUni) and the “Student Financing Fund” (FIES) contributed to a larger number of college students from low -income population layers. In the time of the government of Jair Bolsonaro (2019 - 2022), steps have taken back regarding the protection of the Amazon, namely the increase in clandestine mining exploitation and agribusiness, resulting in increased deforestation, pollution of numerous water courses with strong health repercussions of indigenous populations and biodiversity. It was the time when the “land grabbers” 6 again had more freedom in their activity of falsifying documents that were intended to be proof of land ownership that were actually occupied illegally. After these four years of a far-right government, the country has been directed again by rulers who care about the primary role that Amazon has in the regulation of climate on the global scale and the well-being of indigenous populations. The biosphere is one of the components of the climate system that the most influence has the regulation of climate on the global scale. Much of this component consists of the Amazon, given the most extensive tropical rainforest, with almost seven million square kilometers. It is a vast carbon dioxide sink, contributing to the reduction of the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, and a source of oxygen. The attacks that it has been targeted, motivated by human greed, in the form of deforestation for agricultural exploration make it possible to turn into an extensive savannah, the risk of reaching the point without return of regeneration, in which the forest would move from Co₂ sink to a source of this gas. Lula da Silva, despite being a recognition to be a fighter for the preservation of the Amazon and defender of the measures to alleviate climate change, is the subject of pressures to alleviate these characteristics, which has caused some government tergiversals in the application of environmental protection measures and fighting climate change. Take, for example, the case of Bill No. 2159 of 2021, nicknamed Lula's critics for “PL of devastation”. In discussion since a few years ago, it was approved by the House of Representatives on May 13 this year, before the passivity of the president, who did not give due support to Marina Silva, her minister of the “environment and climate change”. After a few amendments likely to increase the environmental impact, it was recently approved by the Senate. There are even those who claim that the setbacks in environmental policy implicit in this decree-law would not embarrass the government of Jair Bolsonaro, explicitly considered antiamybientalist. Given this situation, the path is open to oil exploration at sea, relatively close to the mouth of the Amazon River, which contradicts the recommendations expressed at the conference on the Cost287 climate, in which it was established, for the first time in this type of conferences, the explicit commitment regarding the need to transition from fossil fuels in energy systems in a “fair, ordered” way to achieve Carbonic neutrality until 2050. This “decree of devastation” allows the existence of “special environmental licenses” (LAE) for projects classified as strategic. These would be subject to the assessment of the body responsible for licensing only for a year, after which they would be automatically approved. The chronic scarcity of personnel of this agency, the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Natural Resources (Ibama), would often allow their approval, paving the way to unpredictable environmental impacts. Given this situation, the accusation of passivity by Lula da Silva is understandable regarding the procedures involving the approval of this decree. The position of the President of Brazil is very uncomfortable, especially more than the next parts of the parties to be promoted by UNFCCC8, COP30, will be held in Belém, Brazil, next November. item.title: The Jacky Cheung concert
item.description: Jacky Cheung (張學友), the famous Hong Kong singer presented a concert in Macao who received great criticism from which two comments stand out in particular. First, the concert increased the casino's recipes. June is unfortunately a low period of time for tourism, but the daily recipes of the game were comparable to May, which proves that the concert attracted many Jacky Cheung fans to Macao and helped the city's economy. If Macau wants to develop the economy by attracting to its international singers, it should take into account its fan base. item.title: Gastronomy Party brings chefs Jordy Navarra and Varun Totlani to the fishermen's dock
item.description: It will take place from next week, between 11 and 20 July, the “International Festival of Cities of Gastronomy - Macau 2025”, which brings Pitéus from all over the world and well -known chefs. The event takes place in the Roman Coliseu Square and the “Legend Boulevard” space of the fishermen's dock, bringing names such as Jordy Navarre, chef and founder of the Toyo Eatery Philippines; and also Varun Totlani, chef of the restaurant of India Masque Restaurant. Both were distinguished in the "The Best Chef Awards 2024" awards, with restaurants that generate to the list of the best Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants Asian restaurants. The program of this party entirely dedicated to the world of gastronomy, organized by the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD), brings, for example, on July 14 the cycle of conferences and debates entitled “The Flavor of Life: Culinary Connections of Macao”, which runs from 9am to 1pm, with three debate panels. This is an initiative held in partnership with the South China Morning Post newspaper that will address the role of spices and aromatic herbs as essential ingredients in the culinarian around the world. It is in this panel that chefs Jordy Navarra and Varun Totlani participate. Global dishes In this cycle of debates on the 14th, 15 guests from Macau, Hong Kong, Taiwan and other countries and regions of Asia are included, namely “scholars, cooks, bartenders, influencers [influencers], restoration industry chefs and integrated resorts”. Topics such as the “History and Legacy of Spices: Review of the Origins of Fusion Cuisine”, “Flavors Symphony: Fusion Culinary in Modern Macao and the World” and “Spices as a Bridge: Celebration of Cultural Fusion and Communities”. According to a STD note, it is intended, in these conversations, to “explore [the history] of the commercial routes of spices and links to gastronomic cultures from various regions of the world”, as well as “innovations in the use of spices in traditional cuisines, cultural lineage and Asian fusion kitchens facing innovation”. DST aims, with this gastronomic festival, to provide “an international exchange” in which “participants will explore together the essence of gastronomic cultures and stories that break geographic and cultural barriers”. Macau was designated as a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy and, in the context of the United Nations Agenda 2030, has developed “various initiatives associated with gastronomy”. In 2016, 2018 and 2019, the “International Gastronomy Forum, Macau” was held, and this event was returned last year in the “International Festival of Cities of Gastronomy, Macao”. With all these events, the government has sought to “enhance the role of Macao as an international dialogue platform, promoting the macao characteristic gastronomic culture, the exchange with the outside and the sustainable development of the tourism sector”.

item.title: City of Dreams | The magic of the fashion world in the Horst P. Horst lens
item.description:
Lovers of fashion and beauty can visit, by September, an exhibition dedicated to the work of fashion photographer Horst P. Horst patent at City of Dreams. “Horst: Style Photographer” is an “iconic fashion photography” exhibition held in conjunction with the prestigious Albert Museum London
It was born at the time when fashion was almost an art form, taking a long time to democratize and reach stores and people. This more classic side of fabrics and seams was certainly eternalized in the photograph by Horst P. Horst, which became one of the great fashion photographers and was born in 1906, named Horst Paul Albert Bohrmann. Horst, who died in 1999, left many full career images of a full career to photograph models, clothing and actresses, creating beauty imaginary that can now be seen closely in a display in the City of Dreams (COD), organized in conjunction with Albert Museum London. The show is called “Horst: Style Photographer” [Horst: Photography of Style] and was inaugurated this Wednesday, revealing the work of this photographer over 60 years. Quoted by a COD statement, Duncan Forbes, director of photography of the London V&A Museum, another of the partners in the organization of this exhibition, spoke on the eclectic side of the work of Horst P. Horst, and can be seen in this show. “From the iconic covers of [magazine] Vogue to the impressive color impressions, Horst's work personifies timeless elegance - a celebration of beauty, posture and artistic accuracy. City of Dreams, with its rich fusion of fashion, design and contemporary art, perfectly reflects the spirit of Horst's work. Horst legacy with a new and demanding audience, ”he said. The exhibition presents a selection of the most representative works of Horst's work, divided into five central themes: “High Couture”, “Surrealism”, “Color Fashion”, “Living with Style” and “Stage and Scree”. According to the same statement, it reveals the “serene elegance of the Parisian couture” and the “bold surrealist explorations”, not forgetting “the pioneering color photography to the vivid portraits of cinema icons”. All of this is up to an “exhibition that offers a rich and multidimensional view of the Horst artistic universe”. Chinese photography In addition, the public will be able to see a special section entitled “Tribute to Horst”, which features works by five influential Chinese photographers, namely Hai Feng, Nick Yang, Trunk Xu, Wu Zeng and Yuangui Mei. This part offers “a glimpse of Chinese fashion photography of the last thirty years, showing its rich cultural dialogues and artistic advances”, which “captures the fascinating interaction between tradition and modernity, oriental and western aesthetics, as well as timeless elegance and contemporary innovation”, highlights Cod. According to the same note, Horst P. Horst is widely considered one of the most influential fashion photographers of the twentieth century, famous for its masterful use of light and meticulous composition. His creative career lasted more than six decades, shaped by artistic movements such as surrealism and the rise of color photography. Its work is known for dramatic tension and artistic depth, providing incomparable aesthetics that remain unparalleled. Horst has also captured some of the most legendary figures in art, literature and fashion - including Coco Chanel, Salvador Dalí, Marlene Dietrich and Andy Warhol - leaving behind an unforgettable legacy. Tim Kelly, president of COD, said, about this exhibition, that "it is a fundamental step in our view of integrating art into everyday life." "The lasting elegance and the innovative creativity of Horst photography are perfectly aligned with the philosophy of our brand. We hope this exhibition will become a platform for creative exchange, where art arouses new ideas and inaugurates a new paradigm where tradition and innovation meet," he said. "Horst: Photography of Style" can be seen on the first floor of Cod until September 12 this year, inviting residents and tourists to "explore a world of timeless fashion, art and light and celebrate the legacy of one of the greatest masters of photography."

item.title: Portuguese works in Biennial that wants to expand contact of Macau with art from abroad
item.description: The Portuguese Rui Calçada Bastos and José Drummond participate this year at the Macao International Art Biennial, which features about 30 exhibitions by artists from over ten countries, the organization told Lusa yesterday. Rui Calçada Bastos and José Drummond, with a longtime connection to the territory, participate this year in the “Main Exhibition” of “Art Macau: Macau International Art Biennial 2025”, the Cultural Institute (IC) said to Lusa after the event's presentation press conference. Contacted by Lusa, Calçada Bastos, who will not be present at the show, said he will exhibit “a re -presentation” of the play “I have not Yet Forget Myself to Stone”, developed in 2021 using concrete pavement and postcards. In representation of Macau, José Drummond, Living in Portugal, presents “The Dream of the Red Chamber”, an installation that integrates a dark room with a sound and a red neon. Also conceived in 2021, the work went to seek the name of the Chinese literature of Cao Xueqin and “explores readings of space between cultures, means and perceptions of time, inspiring both contemporary and classic sources”, reads in a presentation of the artist. The “main exhibition” of the Biennial brings together a total of 46 artists from 13 countries and regions, including Xu Bing (China), Bart Hess (Netherlands), Kimsooja (South Korea) and Lucy Mcrae (United Kingdom), and intends to reinforce “Macao's connection function”, said at the President of the IC today. “We will raise the proportion of foreign works of art to increase contact with the global art network,” said Leong Wai Man, noting that this year the budget is about 4.5 million patacas - less than half of the 2023 edition. The event focuses on the theme “Hello, what do you do here?”, Asks “Common but deep” and that “especially awakens a reflection in this age full of unknowns and challenges,” continued the guardian. “Inspired by this, this year's Biennial invites artists to explore topics such as science and belief, globalization and locality, performing a profound aesthetic dialogue,” he said. Close to you In addition to the central show, the Biennial, which takes place between July 19 and October 19, presents the “Public Art Exhibition: waves and paths”, which, according to the main curator of the event, wants to reduce the distance between population and art. Eight artists expose, in different neighborhoods of the territory, five sets of works, said Feng Boyi. “This year, we do not have a great exhibition (…), but more works will be exhibited that will be integrated into our daily lives, in our community,” he said during the press conference. The “Pavilion of the City”, another section of the artistic event, presents the “Pavilion of the City of Jinan”, the capital of the Chinese province of Shandong (East), curated by the Jinan Museum of Art, and where more than a dozen local artists exploit regional cultural heritage. Also planned is the “Pavilion of the City of Portugal”, curated by the responsibility of the Consulate General of Portugal in Macao and which, according to the program, “exposes the humanist spirit of a small town that combines a long history and innovative vitality”. Lusa contacted Portugal's general consulate in Macao and the Portuguese Foreign Ministry to try to know more details, but so far no response has not been possible. This year is also highlighted to Macao artists, “with about 27 percent” of local participation compared to the last year, according to the president of the IC. The “local curatorship project,” noted Leong Wai Man, “is much bigger” than in the previous edition. "There were four projects, this year we have six. We hope to take advantage of this international biennial to promote local artists, both curators and artists," he continued. Again involving game operators in the territory, the edition will also feature the “Special Exhibition” section, which celebrates, among other artists, the Spaniard Pablo Picasso (1881-1973), with a show at Hotel Gran Lisboa Palace (SJM Resorts), which includes 143 engravings, ceramics and illustrations from the Museo Casa Natal Picasso, in Malaga. Galaxyart, from Galaxy Macau, has been exhibited “over 300 design, sketches and design manuscripts” by the designer, painter and designer of French interiors Bruno Moard.

item.title: Heritage | Visits and workshops celebrate 20 years on the UNESCO list
item.description:
To mark the 20th anniversary of the Macao Historic Center on the UNESCO World Heritage list, IC will organize a series of activities for residents and tourists to rediscove the city's heart. From tours and guided tours to key points, workshops, games and activities for children, there will be no shortage of proposals to enjoy the Historic Center
Next July 15, it has been 20 years since the Macao Historic Center was on the United Nations World Heritage List of World Heritage, Science and Culture (UNESCO). The date has not passed by the Cultural Institute (IC), which proposes a calendar of activities to mark the recognition of the patrimonial value of the city's heart, sprinkled by a set of historical buildings and structures that witness a past with more than four centuries of cultural confluences. Among the set of activities planned by the IC to present “new perspectives” of the city center, highlighting “workshops with the presentation of knowledge linked to cultural relics, practical activities, and guided visits that offer renewed glances about the Historic Center of Macao”. The program includes the activities “World Heritage Tours”, “World Heritage Stamps Game” and “Cultural Heritage ・ Literary landscape”. The Youth Educational Tour “Explore World Heritage” will have two different sections and will pass abroad of “attractions” from the Historic Center, including the Mandarin House. The information will be given in Cantonense about "History, Culture, and the architectural characteristics of the places visited." Artistic creation activities and workshops will also be organized. The first section of the educational tour is scheduled for days from July 10 to 15, from 14h to 18h, while the second will take place between July 15 and 20, both with free admission. The recipients of these tours are children between 9 and 12 years old, with the maximum participants set in 18 pairs per session. Registration is open to the single account. Next pages The creation of reading habits for the youngest will have a prominent place in the list of planned activities. Every Saturday and Sundays this month, starting next weekend, Macau libraries will host an activity entitled “The World of Stories”, for children between 3 and 12 years old accompanied by an adult. “With the theme World Heritage, the program aims to cultivate the children's reading habit from an early age and improve the relationship between parents and children, through the narration of stories, handicrafts, singing and interactive games,” says the IC. On Saturdays, between July 5 and July 26, always between 15h and 17h, the sessions will take place in the libraries of S. Lourenço, Verde Island neighborhood, Wong Ieng Kuan in Jardim da Areia Preta and Jardim Luís de Camões. On Sundays at the same time, July 6-27, sessions take place in the Libraries of Taipa, S. Lourenço and Wong Ieng Kuan in the Jardim da Areia Preta. Once again, all sessions will be conducted in Cantonense. Libraries will be featured on another event, not only as a space for activity, but as the object to explore. On July 12 and 19, with two morning sessions, guided tours are guided by the Senate Library and the Sir Robert Ho Tung Library Library. These visits will also have free admission and will be conducted in Cantonense. Entries can be made through the single account. Shadow The launch ceremony of the celebrations of the 20th anniversary of the registration of the “Historical Center of Macao” on the UNESCO World Heritage list is scheduled for July 15, between 14 and 18h ​​at the D. Pedro V. Theater. During the event, you will be put on sale at a stand -mounted IC booth that will offer “special discounts”, as well as a CTT philatelic sales stand, and there will also be room for a draw for those who complete the World Heritage Stamps game. In the chapter of workshops, the IC proposes a lotus tea tasting at the Mandarin House on July 26, between 14h and 17. The event will be attended by a tea master. “Participants will be able to track the entire tea tasting process. The session includes essential tea knowledge, and explanation of tea varieties, tea utensils, infusion process and courtesy standards when serving tea. On the weekend of July 12 and 13, the activity “Macao, through George Chinnery” is held. “Participants will visit Largo de S. Domingos to attend a presentation about the life and work of George Chinnery. Under the guidance of professional instructors, participants will be able to study the artistic techniques of George Chinnery's works, and create their own paintings, inspired by world heritage architecture and similar artistic techniques,” says IC. The crossing between technology and history will be the focus of the 3D model printing workshop ： inspired by the models of the “Architectural Protection of the Forbidden City” exhibition. The event will be held every Saturday, between 15h and 17h, at the Preservation and Transmission Center of the Cultural Heritage of the Macao Palace Museum. Participants will have the opportunity to learn coloring and finishing techniques on 3D pre-impressive models to complete a miniature replica of a model of the “Architectural Protection of the Forbidden City” exhibition. Long party The activities to celebrate the 20 years of inclusion in the UNESCO World Heritage List will last until December, including forums, tea meetings at the Holy House of Mercy building, night guided tours to the Fortress of the Guide. Professional stages and dirt wall restoration workshops will be organized, typical Lingnan architecture roofs, and stucco creations. Regarding the recognition of UNESCO, the IC states that "distinction, not only evidenced the unique urban character of Macao, which has the mix of eastern and western cultures, but also significantly raised the cultural status of Macao at the international level." The government also emphasizes the work of protecting cultural heritage carried out in the last 20 years, obtaining “expressive results”, which “contributed to the progressive awareness of residents regarding the importance of protecting this heritage”.

item.title: UCTM professor participates in UN Committee for the Space
item.description: Xu Yi, professor and researcher at the State Lunar and Planetary Science Laboratory at Macao University of Science and Technology (UCTM), first participated as a member of the Chinese delegation of the United Nations Committee (UN) for the outside space. The body concerned is called the United Nations Committee for the peaceful uses of the outer space (Copuos) and held its 68th session in Vienna, Austria. Xu Yi participated in the discussion of topics such as “Space and Water” and “Space and Sustainable Development”. According to official information, “the participation of an academic of Macao in Copuos reflects the support of the central government to the scientific and technological development of mashes”, which demonstrates “the success” of the practice of “one country, two systems” in the territory. In turn, Xu Yi said that "the state laboratory will continue to contribute to Chinese spatial exploration, strengthening the role of Macao in the national scientific advance." This State Laboratory was approved by the Ministry of Science and Technology of China, and was officially established in 2018. In turn, the State Lunar and Planetary Science Laboratory of the University of Science and Technology of Macau is the only Chinese national laboratory dedicated to astronomy and planetary sciences. Its creation, according to the same official sources, "aligns with the strategy of boosting space exploration, promoting technological innovation in the great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay and raising the scientific level of Macao." Currently, the laboratory has over 40 experts and a research team with over 200 members. With history Copuos was founded on the UN in 1959 and aims to “establish principles and regulations for the peaceful use of the outer space, to promote international cooperation in this area and to study scientific and legal issues related to spatial exploration”, explains the same note, which also accounts for events held in the context of this Copuos meeting. It is "One Humanity, Infinite Frontiers" [a humanity, infinite borders], organized by China and that took place at the UN headquarters in Vienna, being an exhibition that celebrated the "20 years of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program." Xu Yi participated in this event and shared “The Trajectory of the State Laboratory in supporting the Chinese National Space Agency”.

The popularity of Pop Mart toys was used by the Macao government to stimulate tourism in the region. Among those drawn, about 59,000 Pop Mart -limited edition thematic awards were issued, the STD added. Until September 21, places such as sidewalk of the São Lázaro church, Luís de Camões Square, Santo Agostinho Largo and Pai Kok da Taipa Street will be taken by facilities with the popular Baby Molly, Crybaby, Dimoo and Labubu characters. According to the preliminary data advanced yesterday by STD, in the first three weeks of the initiative the facilities located in the four neighborhoods, and the base of the event installed in Largo do Senate, attracted about 153,000 visits, generating 620,000 consumer draws. The sharing of tourist photographs where pop Mart dolls are culminating the promotion work on social networks that STD has done before the project was opened, to which it was attended by “digital influencers” from the interior of China to create content, “including live broadcasts and publications with short images and videos”. item.title: Commerce | Supermarket closure is “strategic adjustment”
item.description:
IP Sio Man, president of the Vang Kei Hong Commercial Agency, discourages the recent closure of some supermarkets in the territory and states that it is only an “adjustment” in the commercial strategy, related to poor location of spaces and the necessary reduction in the number of establishments
The closing of supermarkets in Macao is not a sign of a major economic crisis, but of a necessary trade adjustment by the brands. Who says it is IP Sio Man, president of the commercial agency Vang Kei Hong, who yesterday in a public event said that the recent closure of these commercial spaces was just a "strategic adjustment" by the companies. “Firstly, when we talk about closing we realize that these are individual cases. Then we have a large proportion of supermarkets [by number of inhabitants in Macao]. There are supermarket chains that are adjusting because they opened on the wrong places and simply closed and changed to other zones.” The official, who spoke to journalists on the sidelines of the company's 50th anniversary, said the market has changed and that there are some economic sectors that are reducing the number of spaces, not just supermarkets. "Macao has about 680,000 inhabitants, but about 100,000 people do not usually live in the territory. The [supermarkets] number is too excessive, and the situation is similar in markets," he said. Vang Kei Hong provides foods and goods to retailers, restaurants, hotels and resorts. Its president also gave the example of banks, who are closing branches. In your opinion, this does not mean a scenario of economic retreat, but simply a strategy change, given that there are more and more online services that customers can enjoy. Neighborhoods suffer Asked about the panorama of the economy in the relationship with the social sector in the first half, IP Sio Man argued that the results are varied, with tourism to record a breakthrough. However, he said that traders in community neighborhoods, where there is less tourism, continue to suffer from the lack of customers. For this reason, IP Sio Man argues that Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) themselves have to change their commercial strategy. The businessman believes that in the second half of this year, the business environment can improve, as Hong Kong has revealed prosperous growth, and Macau has also had a larger number of tourists. IP SIO MAN, therefore, indicated that SMEs have to focus on ways to attract tourists consumption. "I don't think it's a matter that tourists don't want to spend money. They just consume products that guarantee them the best cost-benefit ratio," he added. One of the examples referred to by the entrepreneur is the bitter tea brand in the interior of China Wanglaoji, which registered an increase in sales to about 30 containers, while in previous years sales were only one digit.

item.title: Cape Verdeans who learned to manage casinos in Macau
item.description: A group of 17 Cape Verdeans went to study in Macao, with the aim of integrating the management of a Casino Hotel under construction on the beach. Nine years later, the work was over and most emigrated. In November 2016, Belany Lopes, then 22, wore the skin of 'Croupier' and, behind a table, separated and scattered chips of different colors, methodically, through the green cloth while numbers. “I was doing Blackjack calculations. At first it looks difficult, but with practice it is easy! It's interesting,” he told Lusa, months after reaching the Chinese region to study at the then Macao Polytechnic Institute. Nine years later, Belany Lopes recalls that she decided to register for the Business Management Degree, variant in game management and amusement, partly “due to the promise of already having a guaranteed job”. "Any young man who comes from a more humble family and goes to the university will think that the job is certainly the main focus," said the young woman, who had given up a biochemistry course in Brazil. The lost venture In 2015, the Macau Legend group had signed an agreement to build a tourist project at the Santa Maria Island and Gamboa waterfront, in Praia, which included a 25 -year concession contract. It was the largest tourist venture for the country, scheduled for 2019 and an estimated investment of 250 million euros - about 15 percent of the annual economy of Cape Verde. Shortly after they arrived, Cape Verdean students had a dinner with Macau Legend leader, businessman David Chow Kam Fai. “He told us that when we finished the course, the Cabo Verde-Casino Hotel would be ready,” recalls Lania Fernandes. “In the first year, it has always been very reinforced that we were important, that we would be the first, that there was a plan for us,” says Belary Lopes. But in April 2019, the Cape Verdean government agreed to review the deal, with Macau Legend to promise to invest 90 million euros in a first phase of the project, opening in 2021. In January 2020, most young people were in Cape Verde on vacation when Macau decided to end all schools to try to control the new coronavirus. Cape Verdeans finished the course with classes only online. “We didn't have any undergraduate ceremony,” laments Jeremiah Fortes Vaz. The current Polytechnic University of Macao (then Polytechnic) confirmed to Lusa that the degree in Business Management, variant in gambling and amusement, has not since received any student from Cape Verde. Lania Fernandes stresses that the Polytechnic staff still tried to help Cape Verdeans get work in the Macao casinos. "But because of Covid, we didn't do that," laments the young woman. Macau Legend suffered a new setback in November 2020, when the Cape Verde financial regulator rejected the company's request to create the Sino-Atlantic bank. "They have always remained very optimistic. But many people always said that perhaps if that bank was not approved, the project would not walk," recalls Jeremiah Fortes Vaz. Many dropouts The newly granted still sought work in the archipelago, but eventually gave up. “I left Cape Verde's interior to go to Macau, then came back, but had no contacts. I speak four languages, sent curriculum to different sites, got one or two interviews. After a year in it, I thought, 'Here's nothing to me,'” explains Fortes Vaz. Lania Fernandes was internship at the Family Ministry, Inclusion and Social Development, for ten months, through the Institute of Employment and Vocational Training. "I have dreams, I have ambitions. I can't stay in Cape Verde to win 20,000 shields [181 euros] a month," says the young woman. Both Lania and Jeremiah Fortes Vaz eventually emigrated in 2022 to Massachusetts in the northeast of the United States. But do not regret the passage through China. “My trip to Macao has changed my life completely,” says strong Vaz. “I learned things I took to life, different cultures, gastronomy, how a first world city works. So everything was worth it,” he says. For Belany Lopes, the degree in Macao led to a master's degree in Hungary and a work at a wind turbine manufacturer in Portugal. “Everything I learned at the university, with the people I met in Macau, I feel they opened the doors to be where I am today,” says Cape Verdean.

item.title: Massages | Detained for obliging maid to masturbate customers
item.description: Two brothers, local residents, were arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of obliging a maid of a massage salon in the Nam Van zone to masturbate customers. The Judicial Police received the complaint of the employee, a non-resident worker of Indonesian nationality, on June 3. According to the report of the police authorities, quoted by the newspaper or Mun, the massage hall was opened in May last year and about two months later the complainant was hired through an employment agency. From September, the suspects will have begun to ask the maid to masturbate customers. The center received 1680 patacas for each massage with “happy ending”, while the victim received 150 patacas. The complainant indicated to the authorities that she felt she had no choice to deny the order, since she had to pay the employment agency commission and feed the family. As such, since then, it will have provided the “extra service” about 100 times. The two brothers, who refused to collaborate with the PJ, were referred to the prosecutor on suspicion of the crime of lenocym.

item.title: Real Estate | Number of transactions drops to half 2024
item.description:
Within a year, the number of housing transactions has dropped to less than half, taking into account data from the first half of June. In turn, the average price of the square meter had a reduction of 29 percent
In the first half of June the number of housing purchases and sales fell more than half compared to the same period, with a total of 80 transactions. The numbers were revealed yesterday by the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). According to the data presented, the first 15 days of June recorded 80 transactions, of which 53 took place on the Macao Peninsula, 25 in the mud and two in Coloane. Compared to the same period, 77 transactions had been recorded on the Macau Peninsula, 59 in the mud and eight in Coloane. The real estate market situation shows a slowdown not only in relation to the number of transactions, but also at the average value of the square meter, which sank 29 percent. In the early days of June, the average price of the square meter was 65,618 patacas, with the average to be 67,332 patacas in the Macao peninsula and 61,813 patacas in the mud. Coloane's average price was not specified as the number of transactions was less than three, which leads to the data not published for privacy reasons. In comparison, in the first half of June last year the average housing value was 92,439 patacas per square meter. In the peninsula the average square meter was 82,718 patacas, in the mud of 105,106 patacas and in coloane of 102,862 patacas. More stabilized If the comparison only takes into account the first half of May this year, the market is in a situation of greater stability, both at the level of transactions and the value of the square meter. In terms of the number of transactions, the beginning of June presented an increase in two purchases and housing sales compared to the first half of May, from 78 transactions to 80 transactions, a growth of about two percent. In May, 66 housing purchases and sales had been registered on the Macao Peninsula, nine in the mud and three in Coloane. In terms of prices, the market presented a six percent devaluation of the average value of the square meter. In May, the average value was 69,634 patacas per square meter. He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. item.title: Tariffs | Beijing evaluates the USA-VIETNAME Pact and promises to protect your interests
item.description: The China Ministry of Commerce yesterday expressed “firm opposition to any trade agreement achieved at the expense of China's interests,” reacting to the announced pact between the United States and Vietname, and admitted to adopting contracted. "What Washington designates as 'reciprocal tariffs' about its trading partners is a unilateral intimidation practice, to which China has always opposed," Tutelae spokesman He Yongqian said at a press conference. According to the official, Beijing "has taken a note of the situation and is assessing it", stressing that China encourages the parties to solve economic and commercial differences "based on equality and through dialogue", but firmly rejects agreements that harm their interests. "If such a situation is confirmed, China will be resolutely adopted and will protect its legitimate rights and interests," he said. item.title: Wang Yi exhorts European Union to avoid confrontation
item.description: Chinese diplomacy chief Wang Yi warned his European homologous yesterday against the risks of confrontation, at a time when Beijing seeks to affirm himself as a reliable partner, compared to US volatility. During a meeting held on Wednesday in Brussels, with the head of European Union diplomacy, Kaja Kallas, Wang Yi argued that China and the EU “should not be seen as opponents for their differences, nor seek confrontation due to their disagreements,” according to a statement released yesterday by his ministry. The day before, Kallas argued that Beijing should no longer threaten European security, pointing out alleged cybers, interference in democratic processes and unfair business practices. "Europe faces several challenges," said Wang Yi, adding that none of them, "in the past, present or future," was caused by China. Alternative via Chinese diplomacy head sought to present his country as a counterweight to Donald Trump's administration, which threatened to impose widespread tariffs on European imports. “The path followed by the United States should not be used as a mirror of China,” said Wang. "China is not the United States," he said. According to the statement of the Chinese Foreign Ministry, both sides also addressed international issues such as the War in Ukraine, the Israelo-Palestinian conflict and the Iran's nuclear program. Beijing and Brussels should act based on “mutual respect,” defended Wang Yi, appealing to a more “active and pragmatic” European policy in relation to China. Wang also met on Wednesday with the President of the European Commission, Ursula Von Der Leyen, and Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot. Wang told both parts that China and EU should “defend multilateralism and free trade” and cooperate over global challenges such as climate change. The Chinese diplomat now goes to Germany and then to France, where he will meet with French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot, who visited China in March. These visits precede the China - EU Cimeira, which will bring together in Beijing Chinese President Xi Jinping and several senior European responsible.

item.title: USA / China | Closed agreement that provides for rare land and chip design software
item.description:
The two nations resumed the path of understanding last month in Geneva
United States and China formalized a commercial understanding reached last month in Geneva, which includes Beijing's commitment to resume rare land exports, US Secretary of Trade, Howard Lutnick said. According to Lutnick, the agreement was signed two days ago and consecrates the terms negotiated between Washington and Beijing throughout this year after successive mutual accusations of violation of previous agreements. "They will give us rare lands and, when they do, we will raise our contracted," he said in an interview with Bloomberg. Siemens AG, one of the world's leading semiconductor design software suppliers, has been released by the United States Department of Commerce from the need to request licenses to operate in the Chinese market, according to the German company in a statement. Export restrictions had been imposed in May, as part of a package of measures adopted by the United States in response to Chinese limitations on rare land exports. Siemens has confirmed that it has restored full access to its software and technology for Chinese customers. The other two main world companies in the Electronic Design Automation Software sector (EDA) - Cadence Design Systems Inc. and Synopsys Inc. - They have not yet responded to commenting on whether they received similar communications, according to Bloomberg news agency. The United States Department of Trade has not commented either, the agency added. The rare lands are crucial materials used in the production of wind turbines, aircraft, semiconductors and advanced technology. Under the commercial agreement last week, Washington has committed to authorizing the shipping to China's chip software, ethane and jet engines, as long as Beijing meets the promise of accelerating the approval of critical mineral exports. An White House official confirmed that the two countries agreed with the terms necessary to apply the Geneva Agreement. The China Embassy in Washington refused to comment, while the Chinese Foreign Ministry did not respond immediately. Markets applaud The signing of the agreement generated optimism in the markets: Asian shareholders and European futures have advanced, and a global stock index has reached a new historical maximum. Lutnick indicated that US President Donald Trump intends to conclude, by July 9, a series of ten commercial agreements with major US partners. "We will close the ten main agreements, organize them by categories, and the other countries will align after that," he explained. Although he did not specify which countries involved, Trump suggested yesterday that the US is close to an understanding with India. The main Japanese negotiator, Ryosi Akazawa, also has scheduled meetings in the US capital, and reiterated that Japan "cannot accept" 25 percent tariffs on cars. Trump has already stated that, in the absence of agreements until July 9, he will send "letters" to each country with the proposed terms, applying unilateral tariffs - the so -called "reciprocal tariffs", which may reach up to 50 percent. Most of these measures were announced on April 2, but suspended for 90 days to allow negotiations. The actual scope of the agreements remains uncertain, as commercial pacts usually require years of negotiations. An earlier agreement with the UK, for example, continues with pending issues, including tariffs on imported metals. Out The agreement now reached with China does not address more sensitive topics, such as fentanyl trafficking or full access from US companies to the Chinese market. The first round of negotiations in Geneva resulted in a rate reduction by both parties, but was quickly followed by mutual accusations of non -compliance. After new talks in London this month, negotiators announced an understanding, subject to the approval of Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping. According to Lutnick, the survey of US counterfeit depends on the effective arrival of the rare land. This week, the US Department of Commerce has already authorized ethane loading to China, although its landing remains conditioned on specific authorization.

item.title: Timor-Leste | IMF foresees economic growth of 3.9% in 2025
item.description:
International Monetary Fund forecasts maintain the former Portuguese colony towards development and advise the young country to invest more in the sectors of infrastructure, health and education
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said yesterday that it provides 3.9 percent economic growth for this year in Timor-Leste and insisted that the government should give priority to quality expenses in infrastructure, health and education sectors. "Growth is expected to remain robust, being 3.9 percent by 2025, supported by tax expansion and strong credit growth, predicting a slowdown to 3.3 percent in 2026," Carrière-Swallow said, who led the IMF team, which ended a visit to the country yesterday. The team arrived in the country on June 19 to make discussions under Article IV of 2025. "Inflation, which had fallen sharply last year due to the descent of global food and energy prices, should moderately increase by rising international food prices," said Carrière-Swallow. The IMF predicts that inflation is 0.9 percent this year and increases to 1.8 percent by 2026. The financial organization, which held meetings with the Timorese authorities, private sector, development partners and civil society, also considers that the state budget for 2026 should give priority to “quality expenses in the areas of physical infrastructure and human capital, including health and education, while controlling recurring spending”. "The government is rightly centered on the identification of measures to contain the public sector wage, which has grown sharply in recent years, and the implementation of an added value tax (VAT) from January 2027," says Carrière-Swallow. Reform, it takes The IMF recommends structural and budgetary reforms for 10 years to allow the Timorese government to support the development of the private sector through the gradual reduction of budgetary deficits to preserve debt sustainability. "By 2026, the reforms we propose would be compatible with an expense envelope of about $ 1.85 billion to the central government," read the statement. In the statement, the IMF congratulates the government for “continuous progress in the reforms of the financial sector” at the level of legislation, “whose implementation will support the development of the private sector”. "We also recommend accelerating the issuance of ownership securities and establishing a national digital identification system, crucial reforms to improve access to credit, diversify the private sector and increase the efficiency of public spending," adds the IMF.
Expense The Timorese government set this week the expense for the state's general budget of 2026 by $ 1.85 billion, a significant reduction in 2025. At the end of last year, the Timorese Parliament approved the state's general budget proposal to 2025 worth $ 2.6 billion. Predictions of the Timorese government point to an economic growth of 2.7 percent by 2026 and 4.3 percent for this year. Regarding inflation, the Ministry of Finance predictions indicate that the descending trajectory will continue in 2025, and it is expected to reach 1.8 percent, and to stabilize at 2 percent over the next five years.

item.title: Alibaba launches offers of 6.5 mme to stimulate consumption
item.description: Chinese technology electronic trade platform Alibaba announced yesterday that it will provide $ 7 billion in offers for certain products in an attempt to stimulate domestic consumption. TAOBAO, a platform launched by Alibaba in 2003 and leader of electronic trade in China, indicated, in a statement released through the Wechat social network, that the 50 billion Yuan will be attributed “directly to consumers and traders” over a period of 12 months, starting yesterday. Incentive measures, focused mainly on the functionality of “lightning purchases” of the application, will include “red envelopes” -digital version of traditional monetary gifts -product discounts, free deliveries and commissions reductions for sellers. According to the company, offers aim to "provide consumers experiences and preferential and more convenient services, further encouraging the vitality of consumption." Combat ongoing The decision arises at a time when Beijing tries to counteract deflationist pressures that threaten economic growth, in a scenario already marked by a prolonged crisis in the real estate sector, drop in exports and domestic consumption in slowdown. Since last year, Chinese authorities have implemented several measures to boost internal demand, including cuts in interest rates, real estate stimuli and incentives for purchase of automobiles and electrodomestics. The results, however, have been mixed: although retail sales - the main indicator of private consumption - have registered an acceleration in May, sales prices in the real estate continued to fall in that same period. On Tuesday, Chinese President Xi Jinping called for efforts to “promote the construction of a unified national market” during a high level meeting on economic policy, according to the Xinhua official news agency. During the meeting, the Chinese leaders also advocated a better regulation of “disordered competition based on low prices” between companies. "At a time when the Chinese economy faces deflationary pressures and a fragile job market, the government seeks to respond to these challenges on the side of the offer," said Pinpoint President Asset Management, Zhiwei Zhang, after the meeting. "The priority seems to be to avoid excessive competition," he added.

item.title: I read Qiang in Brazil to participate in the Brics Cimeira
item.description: China Prime Minister Li Qiang is expected on Saturday in Brazil to participate in the BRICS Summit before making an official visit to Egypt, the Chinese foreign ministry announced yesterday. "By invitation, the Prime Minister of the Council of State, Li Qiang, will participate in the 17th BRICS Summit in Rio de Janeiro, July 5 and 08," said a spokeswoman for Chinese diplomacy, quoted in a statement. The same source added that Li Qiang will then move to Egypt, where he will make an official visit between July 9 and 10, at the invitation of the Egyptian Prime Minister. This is the first time that Chinese President Xi Jinping is missing a summit of Brics Emerging Block leaders since reached power in 2013. Chinese sources cited by the Hong Kong South China Morning Post newspaper reported that the fact that XI and Brazilian president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, had frequent meetings last year weighed on the decision. The two leaders gathered during the G20 summit in Brazil last November, before a state visit to Brasilia. A few months later, Lula moved to Beijing to a meeting with Latin American countries and Caribbean. Xi rarely visits the same country two consecutive years, except Russia. The absence of XI could weaken Beijing's efforts to reinforce China's global influence through the BRICS group and build an alternative to the United States's international order. Growing The summit could also provide to the Chinese leader a first meeting with Iran's guardians since the beginning of the war with Israel, after Tehran joined the block in 2024. Under Chinese leadership, the Brics group doubled in size last year, joining nine members with the entry of the United Arab Emirates, Iran, Egypt and Ethiopia, who joined Brazil, Russia, China, China and China and South Africa. Lula is considered one of Xi's closest partners in the international level, along with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Open, there is the possibility of Xi Jinping to participate in the United Nations Climate Conference, which will be held in Brazil later this year, although Beijing has not yet confirmed the trip.

item.title: Independencies | China greet Cape Verde and highlights solidity of the bilateral relationship
item.description:
Beijing greeted the former Portuguese colony for development in the last 50 years and has been open to continue to develop cooperation ties with the African country
China today greeted the 50th anniversary of Cape Verde's independence, highlighted the solidity of the bilateral relationship and said it was available to reinforce cooperation in areas such as infrastructure, education and health. In a written response sent to Lusa, the Chinese Foreign Ministry has congratulated the archipelago by the birthday, which is marked Saturday, and said that the African country "has achieved important progress in its national development," wishing it continues to "move firmly on the path of revitalization." In the note, it refers that relations between the two countries have been marked by “mutual political confidence” and “fruitful” results in multiple domains, in a partnership that both governments consider strategic. "China is willing to work with Cape Verde to deepen pragmatic cooperation and apply the consensus achieved under the Beijing Cimeira of the China-Africa Cooperation Forum (FOCAC)," the ministry said. In recent decades, China has consolidated its presence in Cape Verde through investments in public works, technical cooperation and assignment of scholarships. Among the projects funded by Beijing are the National Stadium and the new headquarters of the National Assembly. Good partners Speaking prior to the islands Express Weekly, former Cape Verdean Foreign Minister Rui Figueiredo Soares described China as "a safe and first-rate partner for the development of Cape Verde." Cooperation extends to the area of ​​education, with more than a dozen scholarships annually by the Chinese government. Since 2010, hundreds of Cape Verdean students have attended higher education institutions in China, in areas such as Engineering, Medicine, Tourism and International Relations. “I arrived 17 and felt right at home,” said Helder Fernandes, a natural Cape Verdean of Santiago Island, who studied computer engineering on the tropical island of Hainan, southern China, where he opened, however, a restaurant. In the diplomatic plane, Cape Verde has reiterated his support to the “one China” principle, recognizing Beijing as the country's only legitimate government over Taipei. On the other hand, Cape Verde benefited from multiple debt by China - namely about 1.18 million euros in 2007 and 1.39 million euros in 2016 - and received technical support in the areas of agriculture, fishing and health, including sending medical teams and fishing projects. Through FOCAC, Cape Verde has also sought to reinforce access to financing and external technical support, with a view to compliance with the objectives set in its strategic sustainable development plan.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
